conclusion: Understand how shadows change when light source moves
Light source in front, shadows A, B, C, D on ground
A is cast by blue object
C is cast by black object
D is cast by white object
Light source moves to back left, shadows shift accordingly
Light source moves to back right, shadows shift accordingly
Shadow A shifts right and becomes longer when light moves back left
Shadow A shifts left and becomes longer when light moves back right
Shadow B shifts right and becomes longer when light moves back left
Shadow B shifts left and becomes longer when light moves back right
Shadow C shifts right and becomes longer when light moves back left
Shadow C shifts left and becomes longer when light moves back right
Shadow D shifts right and becomes longer when light moves back left
Shadow D shifts left and becomes longer when light moves back right
Final answer: Shadows shift right and become longer when light moves back left
Final answer: Shadows shift left and become longer when light moves back right
